definition: Hatoyama Yukio (1947-), Japanese Democratic Party politician, prime minister 2009-2010
turtledove/(literary) to gather
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
surname Ji/also pr. [Ji4]
order/discipline/age/era/period/to chronicle
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
husband/man/manual worker/conscripted laborer (old)

sentences.english: Prosecutors said they wouldn't indict Mr. Hatoyama due to insufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 检察官说因为证据不足，不会起诉鸠山由纪夫。

sentences.english: Hatoyama said he was glad to see constant progress in the Japan-China relationship.
sentences.chinese: 鸠山由纪夫对日中关系不断取得进展感到高兴。

sentences.english: Although, Prime Minister Yukio Hatoyama of Japan did get pancakes.
sentences.chinese: 不过，日本首相鸠山由纪夫享受了煎饼的美味。

sentences.english: She arrived in Shanghai Friday following talks with Japanese Prime Minister Yukio Hatoyama.
sentences.chinese: 她在与日本首相鸠山由纪夫会谈后于星期五抵达上海。

sentences.english: The Japanese prime minister, Yukio Hatoyama, is to resign, he said today.
sentences.chinese: 日本首相鸠山由纪夫今天表示他将辞去首相职务。
